abstracts.cdata!:
The project aims to achieve three major
            objectives. They include supporting Government efforts at
            rehabilitation of the national economy, principally through
            assistance with the design and implementation of a coherent,
            global rehabilitation/development program; and (b) designing
            the tools needed to monitor the implementation of this
            program. Thirdly, the venture seeks to; (c) increase the
            country's absorptive capacity in three key economic
            sectors: diamonds, forestry, and transport infrastructure.
            Provisions under the project include: (a) the services of
            ten resident specialists in the sectors of economic
            planning, public finance, external debt, public
            administration, public enterprises, forestry, and diamonds
            as well as a legal expert in a general supporting role for
            several sectors. The project further provides; (b)
            short-term consultants; (c) funds for training,
            identification of possible future projects, and other
            project-related activities; (d) the services of a national
            Project Coordinator; (e) a Project Administrator; and
            finally; (f) housing, vehicles, office equipment and
            supplies, support staff, and other operating costs for
            project implementation.
